name: Humanising Autonomy
slogan: Creating global standards for human-machine interaction in urban mobility
description: Humanising Autonomy envisions a world of natural interactions between autonomous systems and people. Our product creates novel methods to understand human behavior and body language and improve the decision making of autonomous vehicles.

team.name: Raunaq Bose
team.bioHtml: Co-Founder of Humanising Autonomy. Designer & Engineer.

team.name: Leslie Nooteboom
team.bioHtml:
Co Founder at Humaninsing Autonomy

Humanising Autonomy creates a database of body language, to inform autonomous systems of human intent.

team.name: Wies Millenaar
team.bioHtml: Head of People at SAM labs

team.title: Deep Learning Engineer
team.name: Wassim El Youssoufi
team.bioHtml:
Computer vision, Deep Learning, Machine Learning.
Strong understanding of the theoretical aspects of these fields and ability to implement them in Python.

jobs.title: Behavioural Data Scientist - Computational Anthropologist
jobs.description:
Humanising Autonomy is developing solutions that improve how autonomous systems and people interact with each other. We are currently developing industrial solutions within multiple industries, primarily the automotive industry.
www.humanisingautonomy.com

You’ll be part of the core team to build the foundation of the software stack. You will be observing and analysing the motion and behaviour of pedestrians, applying data mining techniques to help reveal the underlying behavioural and cultural patterns and develop a quantitative analysis for integration into computer vision models. This will be built into our software stack for innovative decision-making systems for the major players in the autonomous revolution.
The role would involve large responsibility within the company,  and require the ability to work independently as part of a core team of designers and engineers. Your work will impact how autonomous systems will interact with people - a field whose relevance is rapidly expanding, and from which you can expect a fast-moving adventure!

Summary

Conduct behavioural research, develop and validate models of pedestrian behaviour.
Application of data mining techniques for  analysis of large scale datasets of human behaviour
Competitive salary + equity plan

Qualifications

BSc/MSc/PhD degree in behavioural sciences, data science or a cognate social science
discipline, together with relevant experience or a degree in other disciplines with a strong focus on applications to human behaviour and industry experience showing similar level of thinking.
Data Mining and Visualization Tools
Big Data Queries and Interpretation
Experience answering social science questions through quantitative analysis
of large-scale data sets of human behaviour
Programming languages: R/ Python/ C/C++
Favourable
Experience with OpenCV, OpenCL, OpenGL
Familiarity with natural language processing, machine learning, computer vision or
other techniques to process unstructured data
Database development (e.g. SQL)

jobs.title: Business Developer (jr)
jobs.description:
Want to work with exciting international customers within the tech, ai and automotive industry? 
Join our team as a Junior Sales Manager and that is exactly what you will be doing. We are looking for someone who can help us grow and nurture our sales pipeline and help us on our mission to make cities safer and human centred! 
 
What we do 
We have created a software for autonomous vehicles by combining AI and psychology to fully understand and predict pedestrian, cyclists and other vulnerable road users behavior in order to improve mobility systems. Have a look on our website for some user cases!
 
What you will be doing 
> Lead generation and management of a high performing sales pipeline
> Working with the commercial team to drive new customer acquisition strategies
> Attending events to nurture and grow partner relationships and create new sales channels 
> Developing marketing initiatives that drive lead generation and business development
> Continuously research and identify new trends and channels

We are looking for someone who has:
> Strong relationship building skills and emotional intelligence to build rapport and trust and work effectively with different types of people at all levels
> Passion to grow within the company
> Excellent communication skills
> Interest in the industry and our mission

You will be working with a small and exciting team of engineers, social scientists and commercial talent to shape the future! You will have a big say in how the company runs itself and there will be lots and lots of opportunity for growth. 

Other than having a job with a lot of growth opportunities and a close knit team, working with us has some more benefits: 
>Beautiful offices in Somerset House
> Free access to museums and galleries
> Guaranteed lots of plants in the office
> Flexible working hours 
> Competitive salary and share options
> Pension Scheme
> 25 days holiday per annum + bank holidays
> Cycle to Work scheme

If this sounds like the job for you, we'd love to hear from you! Please apply by sending your application including cv and cover letter to work@humanisingautonomy.com.

jobs.title: Fixed-term Project Management Internship
jobs.description:
Fixed Term Project Manager Internship

Period: January 2019 - April 2019
Location: Hamburg, Germany
Percentage: min. 60%


WHO WE ARE 
Humanising Autonomy is building a global standard of how autonomous systems will interact with people. Humanising Autonomy has built a human intent prediction application that is able to recognise and predict human behavior from visual camera footage. Its main application is in automated vehicles as it allows the vehicle to make better decisions in terms of vehicle path planning and pedestrian interactions to improve the safety, societal acceptance, and deployment of level 2+ automated vehicles.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY
To be part of a London based, fast growing start-up and at the same time get insight into the big fish in the aerospace industry, Airbus, to deliver a successful project. Are you bright, energetic, and a natural people person? Are you a results-driven, go-getter who’s looking for their next challenge in a cutting-edge field? Are you up to a hands-on project?

We are collaborating with Airbus to integrate our software into autonomous mobile robots to improve the safety and efficiency of Airbus’ manufacturing processes. The development of a data set of human behaviours in the manufacturing environment and the integration of our person detection and intent prediction software are an important step towards Industry 4.0 in the aerospace industry.

YOUR ROLE
This role is offered as a three-month position at a minimum of 60%, located in Hamburg.
You will be responsible for the day to day operations of the project and will support the team in London to deliver a successful PoC by mid-April 2019. What does your day look like? You will get one-on-one time with mobile robots, manage the on-sight data acquisition which will inform our behavioural and AI models, and effectively communicate with Airbus as our customer and partner. You will get support from our business development and product team, who will join you in Hamburg regularly. This is a fast-paced project with an ambitious goal and you will be an invaluable member of our team during this time.

Your main responsibilities are: 
- Manage data acquisition on the Airbus production sites
- Set up sensors and data acquisition infrastructure for the trials   
- Day to day communications with our partners at Airbus
- Work collaboratively with your team in Hamburg and in London
- Master your time management and work independently
- Fluent written and spoken German is required for your communications with the team at Airbus. Written and spoken English is a preferred requirement.

The position is compensated accordingly and we can offer you a full-time work desk with access to the internet and lovely people in Hamburg with a possibility for long term employment.
